text: ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES CREDENTIAL
label: HH1

text: FOR ADMINISTRATORS PREPARED IN CALIFORNIA
label: HH1

text: California has a two-tier credential structure. A five-year preliminary credential is the first credential issued
label: TITLE

text: after an individual meets basic credential requirements. A clear credential is issued when all credential
label: BODY

text: requirements have been completed.
label: BODY

text: The Administrative Services Credential authorizes the holder to provide the following services in grades 12 and
label: BODY

text: below, including preschool, and in classes organized primarily for adults:
label: BODY

text: • Develop, coordinate, and assess instructional programs
label: BODY

text: • Evaluate certificated and classified personnel
label: BODY

text: • Provide students’ discipline, including but not limited to, suspension and expulsion
label: BODY

text: • Provide certificated and classified employees discipline, including but not limited to, suspension,
label: BODY

text: dismissal, and reinstatement
label: BODY

text: • Supervise certificated and classified personnel
label: BODY

text: • Manage school site, district, or county level fiscal services
label: BODY

text: • Recruit, employ, and assign certificated and classified personnel
label: BODY

text: • Develop, coordinate, and supervise student support services, including but not limited to extracurricular
label: BODY

text: activities, pupil personnel services, health services, library services, and technology support services
label: BODY

text: An individual must hold an Administrative Services Credential to provide the following services in grades
label: BODY

text: preschool, K-12 and adults:
label: BODY

text: • Evaluate the quality and effectiveness of instructional services at the school site level
label: BODY

text: • Evaluate  of certificated personnel employed at the school site level, with the exception of the site
label: BODY

text: administrator
label: BODY

text: • Student and certificated personnel employee discipline services at the school site level
label: BODY

text: Individuals Prepared Outside of California
label: HH1

text: Individuals prepared out-of-state or in a country other than the U.S. or U.S. territory should refer to
label: BODY

text: Commission leaflet CL-574, entitled Administrative Services Credentials for Individuals Prepared Out-of-State.
label: BODY

text: Requirements for the Five-Year Preliminary Credential
label: HH1

text: Individuals must satisfy all the following requirements:
label: BODY

text: 1. Possess one of the following:
label: BODY

text: a. A valid California teaching credential requiring a baccalaureate degree and a program of
label: BODY

text: professional preparation, including student teaching
label: BODY

text: b.  A valid California Designated Subjects Teaching Credential provided the applicant also possesses a
label: BODY

text: baccalaureate degree
label: BODY

text: State Of California
label: BODY

text: Commission On Teacher Credentialing
label: BODY

text: Sacramento, CA 94244-2700
label: BODY

text: E-mail: credentials@ctc.ca.gov
label: BODY

text: Website: www.ctc.ca.gov
label: BODY

text: Page 2 of 4
label: BODY

text: c. A valid California Pupil Personnel Services Credential, Teacher Librarian Services Credential,
label: BODY

text: Speech-Language Pathology Services Credential, Clinical or Rehabilitative Services Credential, or a
label: BODY

text: School Nurse Services Credential (Clear or Professional Clear level only), requiring a baccalaureate
label: BODY

text: degree and a program of professional preparation, including field practice or the equivalent.
label: BODY

text: d. Holders of the Preliminary School Nurse Services Credential or any of the other Health Services
label: BODY

text: Credentials, such as the school physician, dentist, dental hygienist, optometrist, clinical psychologist,
label: BODY

text: and psychiatric social worker, do not meet this requirement.
label: BODY

text: Complete one of the following:
label: BODY

text: a. A Commission-approved program of specialized and professional preparation in administrative
label: BODY

text: services resulting in the formal recommendation of the program sponsor or,
label: BODY

text: b. A one-year Commission-approved administrative services internship program consisting of
label: BODY

text: supervised in-service training resulting in the formal recommendation by the California college or
label: BODY

text: university where the program was completed or,
label: BODY

text: c. Achieve a passing score of 173 on the School Leaders Licensure Assessment (SLLA), numbered
label: BODY

text: 1010, examination administered by Educational Testing Service (ETS).
label: BODY

text: � Passing examination scores must be used for credentialing purposes within five years of the
label: BODY

text: passing exam date.
label: BODY

text: � Individuals who pass the SLLA numbered 1010 may apply directly to the Commission for the
label: BODY

text: credential.
label: BODY

text: � Please include an original score report showing passage of the examination with the application.
label: BODY

text: � For more information about test content and special administration test dates for the SLLA
label: BODY

text: numbered 1010, please see the California section of the ETS web site at
label: BODY

text: www.ets.org/sls/slsaboutslla.html.
label: BODY

text: � California is NOT ACCEPTING SLLA, numbered 1011, towards certification
label: BODY

text: 3. Satisfy the basic skills requirement. See Commission leaflet CL-667, entitled Basic Skills Requirement,
label: BODY

text: for additional information.
label: BODY

text: 4. Complete three years of full-time experience  (see Terms and Definitions)
label: BODY

text: 5. Verify employment in an administrative position on form CL-777  (An individual who has completed
label: BODY

text: requirements 1–4 above but does not have an offer of employment in an administrative position may
label: BODY

text: apply for a Certificate of Eligibility, which verifies completion of all requirements for the preliminary
label: BODY

text: credential and authorizes the holder to seek employment as an administrator.)
label: BODY

text: Term of the Preliminary Credential
label: HH1

text: The valid period of the Administrative Services Credential is limited by the expiration date of the prerequisite
label: BODY

text: credential.  The administrative credential will expire with and may be renewed with the prerequisite credential
label: BODY

text: by submitting an application (form 41-4) and processing fee.  However, if the prerequisite credential is valid for
label: BODY

text: the full five year period from the issuance date of the preliminary administrative credential, the administrative
label: BODY

text: credential will be valid for the full five year period upon issuance. For this reason, it may take one complete
label: BODY

text: renewal cycle to align the dates of the prerequisite and administrative credentials. By the end of the five-year
label: BODY

text: preliminary period, the holder must meet the requirements for the clear credential.
label: BODY

text: Page 3 of 4
label: BODY

text: Requirements for the Clear Credential
label: HH1

text: Individuals must satisfy all of the following requirements:
label: BODY

text: 1. Possess a valid Preliminary Administrative Services Credential (see Terms and Definitions)
label: BODY

text: 2. Verify a minimum of two years of successful experience in a full-time administrative position in a
label: BODY

text: California public school, nonpublic school, or private school of equivalent status, while holding the
label: BODY

text: Preliminary Administrative Services Credential.
label: BODY

text: 3. Complete one of the following:
label: BODY

text: a. Obtain the recommendation of a Commission-approved program verifying completion of an
label: BODY

text: individualized program of advanced preparation designed in cooperation with your employer and the
label: BODY

text: program sponsor.
label: BODY

text: b. A State Board of Education-approved Administrator Training Program. Verification of program
label: BODY

text: completion (Modules 1, 2 and 3) must be submitted with the individual’s direct application to the
label: BODY

text: Commission.  (Information on the Administrator Training Program, including approved programs
label: BODY

text: and providers, may be accessed through the California Department of Education’s website at
label: BODY

text: www.cde.ca.gov.)
label: BODY

text: c. Meet Mastery of Fieldwork Performance Standards through a Commission-approved program.
label: BODY

text: Colleges and universities with approved programs leading to a Clear Administrative Services
label: BODY

text: Credential may offer a streamlined assessment option to candidates to allow candidates to forego the
label: BODY

text: course work component of the program and allow them to demonstrate their knowledge, skills and
label: BODY

text: abilities through the assessment component of the program.
label: BODY

text: � The assessment must result in formal recommendation for the credential and the application for
label: BODY

text: the credential based on this evaluation must be submitted by the college or university that
label: BODY

text: conducted the evaluation.
label: BODY

text: d. A Commission-approved alternative program based on Commission-adopted guidelines resulting in
label: BODY

text: a formal recommendation from the program sponsor.
label: BODY

text: � The application must be submitted by the program sponsor via the online application submission
label: BODY

text: process.
label: BODY

text: e. A Commission-approved performance assessment, when available
label: BODY

text: Term of the Clear Credential
label: HH1

text: The term of the clear credential may not exceed five calendar years and may be limited to expire with the
label: BODY

text: prerequisite credential (see Terms and Definitions). The clear credential is renewable online.
label: BODY

text: Appeal for Extension
label: HH1

text: The holder of a Preliminary Administrative Services Credential who needs additional time to complete the
label: BODY

text: Administrator Training Program  requirements may be issued a two-year extension upon submission of an
label: BODY

text: application (form 41-4) marked clearly as an appeal, the application processing fee, and a letter on official
label: BODY

text: letterhead from the Administrator Training Program provider verifying enrollment.
label: BODY

text: Individuals not enrolled in an  Administrator Training Program who need additional time to complete program
label: BODY

text: requirements for any of the remaining options outlined above may request a one-year extension upon
label: BODY

text: submission of an application (form 41-4) marked clearly as an appeal, the  application processing fee, and a
label: BODY

text: letter on official letterhead from the program provider verifying enrollment.
label: BODY

text: Page 4 of 4
label: BODY

text: TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
label: HH1

text: Administrative Experience
label: HH1

text: Two years of successful full-time out-of-state administrative service must be completed in a state other than
label: BODY

text: California while serving in a public school. Verification of experience must be on the district or employing
label: BODY

text: agency letterhead and signed by the superintendent, assistant superintendent, director of personnel, or director
label: BODY

text: of human resources. School or district personnel other than the applicant must verify all experience.
label: BODY

text: Experience
label: HH1

text: Three years of successful, full-time experience in a public school, nonpublic school, or private school of
label: BODY

text: equivalent status. This experience may be teaching, pupil personnel work, librarianship, health services, or
label: BODY

text: clinical or rehabilitative services. Substitute or part-time service does not apply.
label: BODY

text: Full-Time Service
label: HH1

text: Full-time service means service for at least a minimum of four hours per day for three-fourths of the total days
label: BODY

text: in the school year. Substitute or part-time service does not apply.
label: BODY

text: Prerequisite Teaching Credential
label: HH1

text: For the purposes of an Administrative Services Credential, a prerequisite credential is defined as a valid
label: BODY

text: credential. An elementary, secondary or special education teaching credential, a Pupil Personnel Services
label: BODY

text: Credential, a Teacher Librarian Services Credential, a Speech-Language Pathology Services Credential, a
label: BODY

text: Clinical or Rehabilitative Services Credential, a School Nurse Services Credential (Clear or Professional Clear
label: BODY

text: level only) meet this requirement.  A Designated Subjects Teaching Credential and a baccalaureate degree, in
label: BODY

text: which case the individual will be required to obtain and possess a valid equivalent California credential issued
label: BODY

text: by the Commission.
label: BODY

text: Holders of the Preliminary School Nurse Services Credential or any of the other Health Services Credentials,
label: BODY

text: such as the school physician, dentist, dental hygienist, optometrist, clinical psychologist, and psychiatric social
label: BODY

text: worker, do not meet this requirement.
label: BODY

text: Rigorous Performance Evaluation
label: HH1

text: Rigorous performance evaluations must be submitted with a verification of their authenticity given in writing by
label: BODY

text: a personnel officer in the district in which the evaluations took place. The evaluations must have been in each of
label: BODY

text: the two last years serving as an administrator. Evaluation ratings must be satisfactory or better. The
label: BODY

text: performance evaluations need to include all of the following:
label: BODY

text: 1. Demonstration of leadership skills
label: BODY

text: 2. Verification of leadership in program implementation and instructional practices
label: BODY

text: 3. Implementation of effective procedure for smooth operations of the school
label: BODY

text: 4. Evidence of self-motivation and continuous professional development and the updating of skills in
label: BODY

text: administration
label: BODY

text: Valid Preliminary Administrative Services Credential
label: HH1

text: For the purposes of the Administrative Services Credential, the term “valid” means that the holder met the requirements to
label: BODY

text: have held the preliminary credential which afforded the individual the opportunity to gain the necessary experience and to
label: BODY

text: complete academic requirements to earn the clear credential. It does not mean that the document must be active date-wise
label: BODY

text: when applying for the clear credential.
label: BODY

text: Reference: Title 5, California Code of Regulations 80054
label: BODY

text: Click here for Professional Preparation Programs for Administrative Services Credentials or visit the Commission’s website at
label: BODY

text: www.ctc.ca.gov
